---
title: DNS Blocking
description: Configure DNS blocking features
---

:::tip

Block lists are automatically updated every 24 hours

:::
# Set up your DNS configurations
To use the Tunnels DNS server, simply configure your network settings to use `127.0.0.1` as your default DNS server

 - MacOS: [Click here for guides](https://www.google.com/search?q=how+to+change+dns+settings+on+macos&oq=how+to+change+dns+settings+on+macos&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUyBggAEEUYOTIHCAEQABiABDIHCAIQABiABDIHCAMQABiABDIHCAQQABiABDIHCAUQABiABDIHCAYQABiABDIKCAcQABiLAxiABDIKCAgQABiLAxiABDIHCAkQABiABNIBCDQzODBqMWo3qAIAsAIA&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8)
 - Windwos: [Click here for guides](https://www.google.com/search?q=how+to+change+dns+settings+on+windows+11&oq=how+to+change+dns+settings+on+windows&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUqBwgAEAAYgAQyBwgAEAAYgAQyBwgBEAAYgAQyCQgCEEUYORiABDIICAMQABgWGB4yCAgEEAAYFhgeMggIBRAAGBYYHjIICAYQABgWGB4yCAgHEAAYFhgeMgsICBAAGBYYHhiLAzILCAkQABgWGB4YiwPSAQg0MjAzajFqN6gCALACAA&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8)
 - Linux: We recommend disabling `systemd-resolved` if enabled. [Click here for guides](https://www.google.com/search?q=how+to+change+dns+settings+on+linux&sca_esv=8c00fc1d70128356&ei=_JHqaIjvLfSxhbIP57OPmQY&ved=0ahUKEwiI3duQ1JyQAxX0WEEAHefZI2MQ4dUDCBE&uact=5&oq=how+to+change+dns+settings+on+linux&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz-serp)


# Enable DNS over HTTPS for extra security
 1. Go to `DNS` in the main menu
 2. Go to `Settings`
 3. Enabled `Secure DNS`

# Enable DNS blocking
 1. Go to `DNS` in the main menu
 2. Go to `Block Lists`
 3. Enabled any block lists you want
